name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about British Columbia research and records

choices.name: Get started with research for your British Columbia ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about finding your ancestors in British Columbia.

    ☆ FS Wiki:—British Columbia—Finding Your Ancestors

  2. Explore resources for British Columbia research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—British Columbia Resources

  3. Learn about resources for finding ancestors in British Columbia.

    ☆ Finding Your Ancestors in B.C.

  4. Use the British Columbia Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—British Columbia Record Selection Table

  5. Explore a variety of records on the FreeCanadianAncestry site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about British Columbia archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about British Columbia archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about British Columbia archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: British Columbia Archives and Libraries

  2. Explore British Columbia library links.

choices.name: Learn about British Columbia city directories.

content.text:
1. Learn about British Columbia city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: British Columbia Directories

  2. Explore city directories in British Columbia on the CanGenealogy site.

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about British Columbia vital and census records.

choices.name: Learn about British Columbia vital and birth records.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital and birth records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about British Columbia vital records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: British Columbia Vital Records

  2. Learn how to access vital records for Alberta and British Columbia in this video.

    ☆ RT—Accessing Alberta and British Columbia Vital Records—19:58


  3. Search for vital records on the Royal British Columbia Museum site.
  4. Explore birth and adoption resources on the British Columbia Government site.
  5. Learn about and search British Columbia marriage registrations.

    ☆ FS: British Columbia Marriage Registrations

  6. Get help with adoption topics on the Adoption Centre of British Columbia Facebook page.
  7. Learn about adoption records on the OriginsCanada site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for death records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about and search British Columbia death registrations.

    ☆ FS: British Columbia Death Registrations

  2. Explore death record resources on the British Columbia Government site.
  3. Explore British Columbia obituaries on the In Memoriam site.
  4. Learn about British Columbia Coroners' records.

    ☆ BC Coroners' Records

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for census records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of British Columbia censuses in this article.

    ☆ FS—British Columbia Census

  2. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for British Columbia state and county census records.
  3. Explore voter lists and city directories on the BCGenWeb site.

QUIKLinks

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore British Columbia cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—British Columbia Cemetery Records

  2. Browse the Interment.net site for British Columbia cemetery records.
  3. Browse the I Dream of Genealogy site for British Columbia cemetery records.
  4. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  5. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about British Columbia maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: Explore British Columbia maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. Explore the David Rumsey collection of British Columbia maps.
  2. Explore the Canadiana maps collection.
  3. Explore the Perry-Castaneda site for maps of British Columbia (search for British Columbia on the page).
  4. Explore historical British Columbia maps on the Historic Map Works site. Select North America, Canada, and British Columbia in the drop-down menus.
  5. Find British Columbia towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.
  6. Search for British Columbia place names on the John Cardinal site.

1. Find links to British Columbia newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Learn about British Columbia newspapers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: British Columbia Newspapers

  3. Learn about researching historical British Columbia newspapers in this tutorial from The Ancestor Hunt.

    ☆
    Research Free Historical British Columbia Newspapers—6:15

1. Explore British Columbia newspaper resources on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Search British Columbia newspapers in the onlinenewspapers.com site.
  3. Search the British Columbia Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Search British Columbia newspapers in the world-newspapers.com site.
  5. Search British Columbia newspapers in the ABYZ News Link site.
  6. Explore British Columbia newspaper resources on the Ancestor Hunt site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for British Columbia research.

content.text:
1. Explore links on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Explore links in Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in GenealogyLinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks to quickly search record collections for British Columbia.

content.text:
• QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  • QUIKLinks point to collections with 50,000 or more records.

1. Explore the FamilySearch page for online genealogy records.
  2. Explore additional record collections in Ancestry.
  3. Explore additional record collections in Findmypast.
  4. Explore additional record collections in MyHeritage.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your British Columbia research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Kamloops Family History Society page on Facebook.
  2. Find additional Facebook pages for British Columbia genealogy on the Genealogy on Facebook site.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for British Columbia research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about British Columbia research.
  2. Search the RootsWeb site for British Columbia research mailing lists.
  3. Explore the British Columbia research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.

choices.name: Learn about British Columbia genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in British Columbia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: British Columbia Societies

  2. Explore British Columbia genealogy society sites on Cyndi's list.
  3. Get help at a family history center in British Columbia.
